title: 114_s3245
content: The Act may be cited as the "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" and supports clinical nurse specialists. The "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" supports clinical nurse specialists by amending Section 811 of the Public Health Service Act to include authorized clinical nurse specialist programs that provide full-time education for registered nurses to effectively care for patients with acute and chronic illnesses. The "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" supports clinical nurse specialists by amending Section 811 of the Public Health Service Act to include authorized programs for nurses to provide care for patients with acute and chronic illnesses. Additionally, the Act defines a nurse-managed health clinic as a primary care facility managed by advanced practice nurses serving underserved populations. The Act also expands the National Advisory Council on Nurse Education and Practice to include clinical nurse specialists. Reauthorization of funding for nursing programs under Section 3. Title VIII of the Public Health Service Act is amended to update various programs and funding provisions to the year 2021. Additionally, Section 831 is amended to include nurse education, practice, quality, and retention grants. Title VIII of the Public Health Service Act is amended to update programs and funding provisions to 2021, including nurse education, practice, quality, and retention grants. Amendments include promoting career advancement for nursing personnel in various training settings and advancing individuals to become professional nurses or registered nurses. The amendment includes developing internships and residency programs with accredited nursing schools to encourage mentoring and specialty development. Subsection (g) is revised to include nurse-managed health clinics. Subsection (h) is removed.
